page.title: 02Braithwell-History
page.content: One of the most ancient villages around Doncaster,Braithwell was known as Bradeuulle in 1086. The Village Cross erected in 1191 purported to be connected with the ransom contributed by the villagers to release Richard 1,a prisoner in Germany.A charter to hold an annual fair was awarded.Moat Hall has connections with Roche Abbey.Once pigeons were bred extensively for food,in the stables and dovecote, now a cottage.Lambcote Grange, dating from 1186,was farmed by the monks of Roche Abbey for 356 years,after which it passed into private ownership.There are several fine old buildings in the district, e.g.Hall Farm,1683. Some have bricked up windows due to the Window Tax,1698-1851. The main street of the village is designated a Conservation Area.
